articles.title: Congratulations from Mahmoud Abbas
articles.content:
Congratulations from Mahmoud Abbas
 Pyongyang, February 10 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il received a floral basket from Mahmoud Abbas, chief of the Palestinian National Authority, on the occasion of his birthday.
					 Palestinian Ambassador to the DPRK Ismail Ahmed Mohamed Hasan handed the basket over to Kim Yong Il, alternate member of the Political Bureau and secretary of the C.C., the Workers' Party of Korea, on Thursday.

articles.title: Floral Basket from Lao President
articles.content:
Floral Basket from Lao President
 Pyongyang, February 10 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il received a floral basket from Choummaly Saynasone, general secretary of the C.C., the Lao People's Revolutionary Party and president of Laos, on the occasion of his birthday.
					 Somlith Chindavong, charge d'affaires ad interim of the Lao embassy here, handed the basket over to Kim Yong Il, alternate member of the Political Bureau and secretary of the C.C., the Workers' Party of Korea, on Thursday.

articles.title: Congratulations from Foreign Diplomats
articles.content:
Congratulations from Foreign Diplomats
 Pyongyang, February 10 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il received a floral basket from officials in charge of cultural and friendly relations of foreign embassies here on the occasion of his birthday. 
					 Hossam Moshir, cultural councilor of the Egyptian embassy, conveyed, on behalf of those officials, the basket to an official concerned on Thursday.

articles.title: Gifts from Russians
articles.content:
Gifts from Russians
 Pyongyang, February 10 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il received gifts from Russian personages on the occasion of his birthday.
					 They included the chairperson of the Maritime Territorial Regional Committee of "A Just Russia", the secretary of the Political Council of the Maritime Territorial Branch of the "United Russia" Party, the mayor of Vladivostok and the chief of the Far East General Customs Bureau.
					
					 The gifts were handed over to the DPRK consul general in Nakhodka on Feb. 1.

articles.title: Cambodian Ambassador Gives Reception
articles.content:
Cambodian Ambassador Gives Reception
Pyongyang, February 10 (KCNA) -- Chhorn Hay, Cambodian ambassador to the DPRK, hosted a reception at his embassy on Thursday to celebrate the birthday of General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					 Present there on invitation were Kim Yong Il, secretary of the C.C., the Workers' Party of Korea, Ri Myong Gil, chairman of the C.C., the Union of Agricultural Workers of Korea, and officials concerned. 
					
					 Staff members of the embassy were on hand. 
					
					 Chhorn Hay said in his speech that the friendly relations between the two countries provided by President Kim Il Sung and Great King Norodom Sihanouk are growing stronger under the deep care of leader Kim Jong Il and King Norodom Sihamoni. 
					
					 The Cambodian people together with world peace-loving people fully support the peaceful policy maintained by the DPRK under the wise leadership of Kim Jong Il, the ambassador stressed. 
					
					 Kim Yong Il in his speech hoped that the Cambodian people under the leadership of Norodom Sihamoni would achieve success in the work to build a peaceful and prosperous country. 
					
					 He expressed belief that the traditional relations of friendship and cooperation between the two countries would further develop in the future.

articles.title: National Photo Exhibition Opens
articles.content:
National Photo Exhibition Opens
Pyongyang, February 10 (KCNA) -- A national photo exhibition opened in the DPRK on the occasion of the birthday of General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					 On display there are at least 300 photos including those on the feats by the leader working heart and soul for the building of a thriving nation of Juche, the human cause of independence and national reunification.
					
					 Among them are pictures on energetic external activities of Kim Jong Il, who made a great contribution to the development of the DPRK-China friendship by visiting China two times last year, and the stirring reality of the country where epoch-making events are taking place one after another.
					
					 Its opening ceremony was held at the People's Palace of Culture on Thursday.
					
					 Present there were Kim Ki Nam, Yang Hyong Sop, officials concerned and working people in the city of Pyongyang.
					
					 An Tong Chun, minister of Culture, addressed the ceremony.

articles.title: Film Shown for Foreign Diplomats
articles.content:
Film Shown for Foreign Diplomats 
						
Pyongyang, February 10 (KCNA) -- The State Film Commission of the DPRK arranged a film show for diplomatic envoys of different countries and representatives of international organizations here on the occasion of the birthday of General Secretary Kim Jong Il. The show took place at the Taedongmun Cinema House on Thursday.
					 Present there were Pak Chun Nam, vice-chairman of the State Film Commission, and creators and artistes in the moviedom.
					
					 The film shown was a Korean feature film "Wheel of Happiness."

articles.title: Art Performance Given
articles.content:
Art Performance Given
						
 Pyongyang, February 10 (KCNA) -- An art performance was given by art groups of ministries and national institutions at the People's Palace of Culture Thursday to celebrate the birthday of leader Kim Jong Il.
					The colorful performance included numbers like "Cantata to Comrade Kim Jong Il", immortal masterpiece "Greeting the Sun Rising over the Taedong River", "Glory to Our Great Party" and "Charm and Reverence."
					
					 The performers highly sang of the Korean people's unanimous reverence for Kim Jong Il.
					
					 In numbers such as "Ongheya for Songun Victory" and "Juche Iron Is the Best" they successfully represented the shining reality of the DPRK.
					
					 Audience included senior party and state officials, the chairperson of a friendly party, officials of working people's organizations, ministries and national institutions and working people in the city of Pyongyang.

articles.title: Agricultural Workers and Women's Union Hold Meeting
articles.content:
Agricultural Workers and Women's Union Hold Meeting
Pyongyang, February 10 (KCNA) -- Agricultural workers and women's union members of the DPRK met in the plaza of the Party Founding Memorial Tower and at the Women's Hall on Thursday to celebrate the birthday of General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					 Ri Myong Gil, chairman of the C.C., the Union of Agricultural Workers of Korea (UAWK), and Ro Song Sil, chairwoman of the C.C., the Democratic Women's Union of Korea, made reports at the meetings which were followed by speeches.
					
					 The reporters and speakers said that the birth of Kim Jong Il in Mt. Paektu, the sacred mountain of the revolution, was a great fortune of the Korean nation that provided rosy future of Juche Korea and a great auspicious event of mankind.
					
					 Under his guidance, the Korean people could advance along the road of victory, displaying the dignity and honor of Kim Il Sung's nation, they stressed.
					
					 They stressed the need for all the people to cherish the pride and self-esteem of the Korean nation blessed with illustrious leaders generation after generation and discharge their role in the grand march for the improvement of the people's standard of living.
					
					 Attending the meetings were Choe Ryong Hae, secretary of the C.C., the Workers' Party of Korea, officials concerned, officials of the UAWK and the DWUK, agricultural workers and women's union members.

articles.title: Int'l Figure-skating Festival to Be Held
articles.content:
Int'l Figure-skating Festival to Be Held
Pyongyang, February 10 (KCNA) -- The 20th Paektusan Prize International Figure-skating Festival is to be held here between February 15 and 17 to mark the birthday of General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					 The festival will bring together star figure-skaters of different countries, who proved successful at World Figure Skating Championships and European Figure Skating Championships, and DPRK figure-skaters who proved successful in international contests. 
					
					 The festival is held in forms of exhibition performances in ice dancing and pairs and individual events.

articles.title: Brisk Preparations for Kimjongilia Festival
articles.content:
Brisk Preparations for Kimjongilia Festival
 Pyongyang, February 10 (KCNA) -- Preparations for the 15th Kimjongilia Festival are at their final phase.
					 The festival has been held as an annual event since 1997 on the occasion of leader Kim Jong Il's birthday.
					
					 The Kimilsungia-Kimjongilia Festival Organizing Committee drafted a plan for successful festival while organizing panels and working out their plans and schedules.
					
					 The committee has successfully completed the designs for internal layout and decoration of festival hall and posters in conformity with the festival's character.
					
					 The venue of the festival is being spruced up.
					
					 The image of Kim Jong Il is put in the center of hall against the background of Mt. Paektu and a large Kimjongilia basket is depicted in the centre of the floor.
					
					 The organizing committee is helping the setting up of stands for displaying potted flowers to be presented by units and individuals.

articles.title: Celebrations to Mark Birthday of Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Celebrations to Mark Birthday of Kim Jong Il
Pyongyang, February 10 (KCNA) -- Colorful events will take place in the DPRK to celebrate February 16, the birthday of General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					 The 15th Kimjongilia Festival is to be held at the Kimilsungia-Kimjongilia Exhibition.
					
					 This festival of flowers in praise of the great man will bring together armed forces organs, ministries, national institutions, industrial establishments, working people of different strata, school youth and children, organizations of overseas Koreans and foreigners.
					
					 There will be the 20th International Figure Skating Festival for Paektusan Prize and the demonstration performance of Synchronized Swimming with excellent sportspersons at home and abroad involved, which will add to the festive mood.
					
					 Final preparations for the festival and demonstration performance are being made at the Ice Rink and the swimming pool of the Changgwang Health Complex by the competent sports experts and art creators.
					
					 The events will also include photo and fine art exhibitions in Pyongyang.
					
					 The Sports Contest for Paektusan Prize has already started.

articles.title: Koreans in Uzbekistan Celebrate Kim Jong Il's Birthday
articles.content:
Koreans in Uzbekistan Celebrate Kim Jong Il's Birthday
 Pyongyang, February 10 (KCNA) -- Koreans in Uzbekistan gave a performance in Tashkent on Feb. 6 to celebrate the birthday of General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					 The colorful performance included numbers like "Nilliri for Songun", "Arirang of National Reunification", "Kim Jong Il's Birthplace in the Paektusan Secret Camp with Frost Flowers" and "We Will Enshrine It for Eternity".
					
					 The audience included Koreans in Uzbekistan, officials of the Cultural Department in Tashkent Region, citizens and the ambassador and staff members of the DPRK embassy in Uzbekistan.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Birthday Celebrated Abroad
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Birthday Celebrated Abroad
 Pyongyang, February 10 (KCNA) -- Lectures and film shows took place in Romania, Brazil and Thailand between February 1 and 5 to celebrate the birthday of General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					 Kim Jong Il is deeply revered by the Korean people, said the chairman of the Romanian Workers' Association at a lecture.
					
					 The dignity and honor of the Korean people have reached the highest level as he turned the DPRK into a political, ideological and military power, he added.
					
					 The deputy mayor of Santos City, Sao Paulo State, Brazil noted at a lecture that Kim Jong Il shaped the plan for building a thriving nation, in which everything thrives and the people live with no more to desire in the world, and has wisely led the drive for bringing it into a reality.
					
					 The Korean people would surely build a great, prosperous and powerful nation as they are led by Kim Jong Il, the director of a Thai tourist company said after watching a film. 
					
					 Films shown included "Pyongyang Today".

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Praised Abroad
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Praised Abroad
Pyongyang, February 10 (KCNA) -- Groups for the study of the Juche idea and friendship organizations of foreign countries released bulletins to mark February 16, birthday of General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					 The Costa Rican Institute for the Study of the Juche Idea carried an article with photo of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 It said that he is bringing into a reality the centuries-old desire of the Korean people for a rich and highly civilized life with no more to desire in the world.
					
					 The Finland-Korea Society carried an article titled "Birthday of Comrade Kim Jong Il, general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea".
					
					 It said that he is a great revolutionary and patriot of Korea who is devoting all his life to the people's happiness and prosperity.
					
					 The Bulgaria-Korea Friendship Association carried articles under various titles including "Birthday of a Great Leader" and "2010, Year of Great Turn".
					
					 The Nicaraguan Group for the Study of the Juche Idea and the Circle of Studies for the Juche Idea in Panama in articles praised the noble personality of Kim Jong Il who continues his dedicated journey for the people on his birthday, too, even though he should receive best wishes from the people.

articles.title: S. Korea Blasted for Making Military Talks Abortive
articles.content:
S. Korea Blasted for Making Military Talks Abortive
 Pyongyang, February 10 (KCNA) -- The inter-Korean high-level military talks aimed at wiping out the mistrust and hostility and preventing confrontation and clash between the north and the south failed to open after all. The north side delegation to the north-south military talks Wednesday issued a communique laying bare the true nature of the persistent confrontation policy of the south Korean group of traitors as revealed through the inter-Korean dialogue.
					 According to the communique, preliminary talks for the opening of the full-dress talks took place in Panmunjom on Tuesday and Wednesday. They were adjourned seven times, wasting time, and ended in rupture.
					
					 The north side at first proposed "On clarifying a view on the 'Cheonan' Case and the Yonphyong Island Shelling and defusing military tension on the Korean Peninsula" as the agenda of the high-level military talks.
					
					 The puppet forces, however, challenged the proposal by insisting on adopting "Responsible measures over the sinking of 'Cheonan' by an explosion and the shelling of Yonphyong Island and giving assurances against additional provocations and sincere approach towards denuclearization" as the agenda of the talks.
					
					 In the course of the preliminary talks they were at a loss how to deal with the north side's just compromise suggestion and perfect logic. They unilaterally insisted on adopting "responsible measures" over the above-said incidents and "giving assurances against additional provocations" as the agenda of the talks till the last moment the talks broke down. They thus revealed their sinister intention to use the north-south high-level military talks as another theatre of inter-Korean confrontation. 
					
					 Meanwhile, they let media float the story that they strongly demanded the north make "apology" for the two incidents and take "responsible measures" over them at the talks.
					
					 As for the north side's proposal for opening the high-level military talks, they came out with an irrelevant proposal for holding the talks between the minister of the People's Armed Forces and their minister of Defense or those between the chiefs of the General Staff of the two sides, departing from their earlier stand. 
					
					 When the north side charged that their unilateral attempt to change the level of the talks, given that an agreement was reached on holding high-level military talks, was an abnormal and immoral behavior, they made an unreasonable excuse, saying "a vice-minister of Defense of the south side is not a high-level person in military authority." They thus threw another hurdle in the way of reaching an agreement.
					
					 When the north side urged the south side to clinch the discussion of technical procedures, even sitting all night, and open the full-dress talks in 3-4 days at the preliminary talks, they asserted their opening around late in February under the pretext of the January 15th of the lunar calendar, the folk holiday, and the time to prepare for the talks.
					
					 They deliberately put off the time for the resumption of the north-south dialogue under this or that pretext, prompted by the foolish calculation that in case late February is fixed as the time for those talks when Key Resolve and Foal Eagle joint military exercises targeting the north are slated to take place, the responsibility for the rupture of the talks can naturally be shifted onto the north side. 
					
					 The communique went on: The puppet forces ran the whole gamut of obstructions and finally made the north-south military dialogue abortive though it was arranged with much effort thanks to the DPRK's proposal for wide-ranging dialogue and negotiations. This was prompted by their sinister scenario to torpedo the processes for peace and stability on the Korean Peninsula and the improvement of the north-south relations and stick to their avowed policy of confrontation against the DPRK to the last.
					
					 They responded to the Korean People's Army's proposal for the talks not out of their true interest in the dialogue but prompted by their ulterior design to dodge the blame for being an arch criminal going against the wishes of the nation and the trend of the times and link the "Cheonan" incident and the Yonphyong Island shelling incident to the DPRK come what may.
					
					 It is the ulterior intention of the group of traitors to reject the north-south dialogue itself, while pretending to be interested in the dialogue, in a bid to bar the six-party talks from being resumed and stem the trend of dialogue of the countries around the Korean Peninsula and keep the phase of confrontation and clash going on. Through this they seek to tone down the public voices at home and abroad demanding them make a switchover in their vicious policy of confrontation towards the DPRK.
					
					 The puppet forces did not hesitate to commit hoodlumism unprecedented in the history of the north-south talks. They unilaterally walked out of the conference room, finally turning down the just assertion of the north side for defusing the tensions and refraining from military actions which may be regarded as provocations by each side, and breached even the elementary courtesy of seeing the delegation of the other side off.
					
					 The army and people of the DPRK do not feel any need to deal with the group of traitors any longer now that they do not wish to see the north-south relations improved but totally reject the dialogue itself.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Greets to Iranian President
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Greets to Iranian President
 Pyongyang, February 10 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, sent a message of greetings to Mahmoud Ahmadinejad, president of Iran, Wednesday on the 32nd anniversary of the victorious Islamic Revolution in Iran.
					 Expressing belief that the favorably developing relations of friendship and cooperation between the DPRK and Iran would grow stronger, Kim in the message wished the President and the people of Iran success in the work for independent development and prosperity of the country.

articles.title: Choe Yong Rim Greets First Vice-President and FM of Iran
articles.content:
Choe Yong Rim Greets First Vice-President and FM of Iran
Pyongyang, February 10 (KCNA) -- Premier of the DPRK Choe Yong Rim sent a message of greetings to Mohammad-Reza Rahimi, first vice-president of Iran, Wednesday on the 32nd anniversary of the victory of the Islamic Revolution in Iran. 
					 The message wished the government and people of Iran success in their efforts to safeguard the gains of the Islamic revolution and make socio-economic progress and development.
					
					 Foreign Minister Pak Ui Chun sent a similar message to his Iranian counterpart Ali Akbar Salehi on the same day.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Receives Credentials from Czech Ambassador
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Receives Credentials from Czech Ambassador
 Pyongyang, February 10 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, received credentials from Dusan Strauch, ambassador of the Czech Republic to the DPRK, at the Mansudae Assembly Hall Thursday.
					 After receiving the credentials, Kim had a talk with the ambassador.

articles.title: Pak Ui Chun Meets Vietnamese Ambassador
articles.content:
Pak Ui Chun Meets Vietnamese Ambassador
 Pyongyang, February 10 (KCNA) -- Foreign Minister of the DPRK Pak Ui Chun met and had a talk with Le Van Cu, outgoing Vietnamese ambassador to the DPRK, on Thursday.

articles.title: German Ambassador to DPRK Gives Reception
articles.content:
German Ambassador to DPRK Gives Reception 
						
Pyongyang, February 10 (KCNA) -- German Ambassador to the DPRK Gerhard Thiedemann hosted a reception at his embassy Thursday. It was given on the occasion of the 10th anniversary of the establishment of diplomatic ties between the DPRK and Germany.
					Present there on invitation were Foreign Minister Pak Ui Chun, Ri Yong Chol, vice department director of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, Chairman of the DPRK-Germany Friendship Parliamentary Group Ri Jong Hyok and officials concerned. 
					
					Staff members of the German embassy and German guests staying in the DPRK were on hand.
					
					Speeches were made there.

articles.title: Foot-And-Mouth Diseases Break out in DPRK
articles.content:
Foot-And-Mouth Diseases Break out
 Pyongyang, February 10 (KCNA) -- Foot-and-mouth diseases broke out in various parts of the DPRK.
					 The diseases which broke out in Rihyon-ri, Sadong District, Pyongyang, at the end of last year spread to North and South Phyongan Provinces, North Hwanghae Province, Jagang Province and Kangwon Province and three other provinces. 
					
					 The most seriously affected areas are Pyongyang, North Hwanghae Province and Kangwon Province.
					
					 Type 0 Foot-and-mouth diseases broke out on cooperative farms, diary farms and pig farms in those areas, doing harm to domestic animals.
					
					More than 10,000 heads of draught oxen, milch cows and pigs have so far been infected with the diseases and thousands of them died.
					
					 A national emergency veterinary and anti-epizootic committee was organized with Kim Rak Hui, vice-premier of the Cabinet, as its chairwoman. An emergency anti-epidemic campaign was declared throughout the country.
					
					 Now the infected areas are quarantined and disinfected and measures are taken to treat those infected with the diseases, according to Ri Kyong Gun, 46, department director of the Ministry of Agriculture.
					
					 The dead animals have been buried.
					
					 All the catering networks and markets have stopped selling meat of the above-said domestic animals.

articles.title: Cooking Contests to Be Held
articles.content:
Cooking Contests to Be Held
Pyongyang, February 10 (KCNA) -- Cooking contests will take place in the DPRK in February and April.
					 February will witness a contest of Sinsollo. This contest is to be taken part in by 25 units from different parts of the country including Pyongyang City.
					
					 In April, there will be a festival of holiday food, national contest of cooking skills, contest of local specialties, contest of breeding fish cooking skills and a contest of sea fish cooking skills.
					
					 The rare fishes to be used in the contests include salmon, sea rainbow trout, sturgeon and eel.
					
					 Besides, exhibitions of raw rice wine, tangogi and adzuki-bean gruel taken on the winter solstice, favorite food and drink of the Koreans, are to be held in various forms and methods.
					
					 The Specialist Restaurant under the Okryu Restaurant and other catering centers in Pyongyang and local areas are now making brisk preparations for the contests.

articles.title: Historical Relics Discovered
articles.content:
Historical Relics Discovered
 Pyongyang, February 10 (KCNA) -- Historical relics dating back to the Koguryo Dynasty have been unearthed in the DPRK.
					 They are a patrol road and a ditch for defence, which were excavated on the Chongam-Dong Earthen Walls in Taesong District, Pyongyang. The walls served as ones for defending Pyongyang, the capital of Ancient Korea. 
					
					 The road, found outside the walls, is paved with flat stones, and it is 1.8 meters wide and 20 meters long. 
					
					 Similar roads have been discovered sometimes inside the walls, but never outside the walls in Korea so far.
					
					 This road was confirmed to be used for patrolling the walls in the period of the Koguryo Dynasty. 
					
					 The ditch is 4 meters in width and 1.5 meters in depth. In view of its structure, this was for preventing aggression by outsiders. 
					
					 These facts have been scientifically proved by a research team of Kim Il Sung University.

articles.title: More Scenic Spots Discovered
articles.content:
More Scenic Spots Discovered
 Pyongyang, February 10 (KCNA) -- 72 more beauty spots were recently found in Sinphyonggumgang scenic site deep in Ahobiryong Mountain Range in North Hwanghae Province in the DPRK.
					 The site had only over 10 noted places before.
					
					 The newly discovered spots include Kuryong Valley, Rojok Rock and 18 others in Kuryong Waterfall Valley as well as Pidan Waterfall, Brother and Sister Waterfall, Brothers Waterfall and 7 others in Kumgang Waterfall Valley. Other scenic spots were found in Okryu-dong, Okryu Great Valley, Tanphung Valley, Tohwa-dong and in the area of Chongsokjong by the Nam River.
					
					 Sinphyonggumgang scenic site (Tohwa-dong, Phyonghwa-ri in Sinphyong County) is so beautiful that it can be called a miniature of Mt. Kumgang.
					
					 Its beauty has been known since late in the 1970s and it turned into scenic spot in the 1990s.

articles.title: Naegok Hot Springs Good for People's Health Spot
articles.content:
Naegok Hot Springs Good for People's Health
 Pyongyang, February 10 (KCNA) -- There are many hot springs conducive to people's health in the DPRK.
					 The Naegok hot springs in Pochon County in the northeastern part of Ryanggang Province is one of them.
					
					 The temperature is 45 degrees centigrade and pH is 7.8.
					
					 All spas are similar in the content of ingredients.
					
					 The total mineral amount of spa No. 1 is 0.6 g/L and Rn is 463.5Bg.
					
					 The contents of bicarbonate ion, sodium ion and magnesium ion, its major ingredients, are 390.4mg/L, 113mg/L and 18.9mg/L respectively. 
					
					 Hot spring is good for the promotion of blood circulation and metabolism, sedation, alleviation of pain, antiphlogosis and control of secretion. It is also efficacious for the reproduction of skin tissues, formation of epithelial cells, etc.
					
					 The spas are situated in the area of moderate climate, surrounded by thousands of thick needle-leaf trees. Nearby nestles a sanatorium.
					
					 Many people including bathers and those who took part in the study tour of Mt. Paektu benefited from the spas for the last decades.

articles.title: Pujon Plateau, Beauty Spot
articles.content:
Pujon Plateau, Beauty Spot
 Pyongyang, February 10 (KCNA) -- Pujon Plateau in the northern part of the DPRK is famous for its peculiar alpine scenery. 
					 It is one of eight beauty spots in Korea. Its area is 1,770 square kilometers and its average height is 1 490 meters. 
					
					 It is surrounded by mountains about 2,000 meters above the sea. 
					
					 The plateau abundant in forest resources has lush foliage of larch, spruce, Abies nephrolepis and other trees. Wild fruits and edible and medical herbs also grow there. 
					
					 The forest is home to many species of animals including bear, wild boar, roe deer and otter. 
					
					 From the plateau one can view the sea of forest, beautiful valleys, large man-made Lake Pujon and sunrise in the East Sea of Korea. 
					
					 The plateau, a vacation spot, is resorted by lots of people every season.

articles.title: School Train at Paekmu Plateau
articles.content:
School Train at Paekmu Plateau 
Pyongyang, February 10 (KCNA) -- It has been 30 odd years since a student commuter train started its service between the Yuphyong Workers' District and Yugok village in Paekam County, Ryanggang Province in northern part of the DPRK. The train has run nearly 500,000 kms so far.
					 At that time this train was for some students in Yugok, Hagyongphyong, Onje and Sinyuphyong villages in Paekam County on the Paekmu Plateau.
					
					 The operation of the train continued even in the period of the arduous march, the forced march when the country was in short supply of everything.
					
					 A few years ago, leader Kim Jong Il acquainted himself in detail with the commuting of students in remote mountainous villages and islets across the country and made sure that relevant units ensured the commuting in a responsible way. So the student commuter trains have run on a regular basis under the care of the state.
					
					 At present the students in Paekam County go to schools by the commuter train sent by President Kim Il Sung.

articles.title: Koreans Denounce S. Korea for Scuttling Talks
articles.content:
Koreans Denounce S. Korea for Scuttling Talks
 Pyongyang, February 10 (KCNA) -- The Korean people are angered by the breakdown of the preliminary talks for opening the north-south high-level military talks that were held on Tuesday and Wednesday.
					 Vice-Minister of Chemical Industry Pak Chol, 52, said that the preliminary talks came to a rupture due to the south Korean military's plan.
					
					 "Responsible measures over the sinking of 'Cheonan' by an explosion and the shelling of Yonphyong Island" was proposed as an agenda item by the south side, he said. This is an insult and provocation to put the dialogue partner on trial, he added.
					
					 If south Korea is truly interested in detente and peace, it should raise points which can lead to a bilateral agreement, he said.
					
					 Vice-Chairman of the C.C., the Union of Agricultural Workers of Korea Han Kyong Song, 55, accused the south side of unilaterally insisting on its stand on the level of the heads of the delegations, not taking into consideration the differing military mechanism and systems in the north and the south.
					
					 Putting off full-dress talks also goes against the desire of the nation and the times for earlier wide-ranging dialogue and exchanges, he added.
					
					 Director of the History Institute of the Social Academy of Sciences Jo Hui Sung, 59, said that the preliminary talks revealed that the south Korean military came out to the talks, weighed down by the domestic and foreign opinions.
					
					 The true intention sought by the south side is to exploit hideous conspiratorial farces in scuttling talks under the pretext of "people's sentiment", shift the blame on to the DPRK side and justify joint military exercises with the U.S. slated soon.
					
					 The 70 million Koreans and the world people are judging who is a chief culprit escalating confrontation and tension on the Korean Peninsula.

articles.title: S. Korea Accused of Killing Military Talks
articles.content:
S. Korea Accused of Killing Military Talks
 Pyongyang, February 10 (KCNA) -- After the north side's delegation published a communique concerning the failed high-level military talks between the two parts of Korea, people of the DPRK have strongly denounced the south Korean authorities for having brought the talks to breakdown.
					 An explainer of the National House of Class Education, Kim Son Hui, 35, told KCNA that the south Korean side has persistently pursued confrontation with the north, impeding the effort for peace and stability on the Korean peninsula and the improvement of north-south relations.
					
					 "The talks broke down because the south side insisted that a vice defense minister is not a high-level person in military authority in south Korea and that the opening of preliminary talks should be put off for the lunar New Year's Day celebration," she said.
					
					 Worker of the Pyongyang Daily Necessities Factory Ri Kwang Su, 31, said that the resumption of the north-south dialogue is mainly aimed to clear up the main cause of deteriorated relations between the north and the south and discuss measures for their improvement.
					
					 But the south Korean authorities are sticking to their unreasonable demand for "responsible measures over the sinking of the Cheonan vessel and the Yonphyong Island shelling" and for a "promise to prevent additional provocations," he said. Their position indicates that they are not interested in dialogue and improvement of relations with the north.

articles.title: S. Korea Branded Dialogue Breaker--KCNA Commentary
articles.content:
S. Korea Branded Dialogue Breaker--KCNA Commentary
						
 Pyongyang, February 10 (KCNA) -- To set an agenda is essential for talks in any case.
					 Therefore, attitude toward agenda serves as an unavoidable factor that affects the whole process of solving any problem at talks.
					
					 The south Korean puppet forces came out with unrealistic issues as an agenda in the preliminary talks for the opening of the north-south high-level military talks.
					
					 The north side at first proposed "On clarifying a view on the 'Cheonan' case and the Yonphyong Island Shelling and defusing the military tension on the Korean Peninsula" as the agenda of the high-level military talks.
					
					 The south side, however, challenged the proposal by insisting on adopting "Responsible measures over the sinking of 'Cheonan' by an explosion and the shelling of Yonphyong Island and giving assurances against additional provocations and sincere approach towards denuclearization" as the agenda of the talks.
					
					 In face of such defiant demand, the north side took courageous decision to amend the agenda several times out of the desire to clear away the disgraceful past and bring about bright prospect for national unity and reunification at any cost.
					
					 But the south Korean puppet forces refused to accept any of those amended agendas and dragged on time by way of proposing to continue discussion next day.
					
					 Eventually, the dialogue came to rupture as soon as it began.
					
					 The process of discussion on agenda is clear evidence showing the intentional and planned obstruction on the part of the south Korean group of traitors determined to derail the preliminary talks at their outset.
					
					 It is illogical for those with sinister intention to take part in any discussion on important matters of the nation.

articles.title: S. Korea's Impudent Approach to Talks Blasted--KCNA Commentary
articles.content:
S. Korea's Impudent Approach to Talks Blasted--KCNA Commentary
 Pyongyang, February 10 (KCNA) -- The south side reacted to the DPRK's patience and magnanimity with arrogance at the preliminary talks for the resumption of the north-south high-level military talks.
					 Its arrogant practice was revealed in the discussion of the issue on the formation of delegations to the talks.
					
					 When the DPRK said that "The Defense minister-level and general-level military talks shall pertain to high-level talks", the south side agreed with it at first. It made an official proposal for letting four star generals head the delegations because it expressed sympathy with the DPRK's view.
					
					 The DPRK took a principled approach to the south side's proposal and made reasonable suggestion to let the vice-Defense ministers lead the delegations and designate their heads in a convenient way.
					
					 But all of a sudden, the south side said that the "vice-minister of Defense of the south side can not represent high-ranking military authority."
					
					 This preposterous rhetoric is quite contrary to its original proposal for "four star general heads". It also runs diametrically counter to the will of its superior who made a written agreement with the Minister of the People's Armed Forces of the DPRK on high-level military talks.
					
					Isn't the south side's vice-minister of Defense a high-ranking officer? Can those who take no account of their superior and do not observe the elementary military discipline of obedience to order be called "soldiers"?
					
					 The south side's words and acts are all contradiction.
					
					 Incoherent in its words and whimsical in its acts, the south side seems to be more concerned for the level of the talks rather than their results. 
					
					 The south Korean authorities, professing a "pragmatic government", prefer modality to profitability when coming to the talks, an act that can hardly win sympathy.
					
					 As a matter of fact, the south side considers the north-south military talks as a platform for confrontation. It seeks to do harm to the north from outdated point of view, not to reconcile and cooperate with it on an equal footing and pave a wide avenue of the nation.
					
					 It has become clearer that the south Korean authorities are not interested in dialogue but keen on stoking confrontation only. This made the DPRK just in its stand that there is no need to have dealings with the south any more.

articles.title: S. Korea's Anti-DPRK Smear Campaign Slashed--Minju Joson
articles.content:
S. Korea's Anti-DPRK Smear Campaign Slashed--Minju Joson
 Pyongyang, February 10 (KCNA) -- Officials of the south Korean Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Trade asked U.S. Deputy Secretary of State Steinberg for reference of the DPRK's uranium enrichment to the UNSC recently when he visited south Korea.
					 The Human Rights Committee of south Korea called for "intensified international cooperation" over "the north's human rights issue" in its "2011 action program".
					
					  Commenting on the facts, a news analyst of DPRK's major newspaper Minju Joson Thursday says:
					
					  Such actions can never be pardoned as they are a treacherous crime of denying inter-Korean dialogue and escalating confrontation.
					
					 Uranium enrichment by the DPRK is for peaceful use of nuclear energy, and it is the legitimate right of a sovereign state nobody can call into question.
					
					 It is the ulterior intention of officials of the south Korean Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Trade to tighten anti-DPRK cooperation with the U.S. over the uranium enrichment issue and thus lay an obstacle to the inter-Korean dialogue on the agenda, put the brake on the denuclearization of the whole Korean Peninsula and persistently escalate the confrontation with fellow countrymen.
					
					 The south Korean Human Rights Committee, too, seeks a way out of crisis in expanding the anti-DPRK smear campaign over the human rights issue to international arena.
					
					 This scheme has been evidently proved by such phrase as "intensified international cooperation" the committee stipulated in its "action program" for this year. Herein lies the sinister intention to intensify the anti-DPRK human rights racket in collusion with foreign forces and thus deteriorate the north-south relations and hinder their wide-ranging dialogue.
					
					 The south Korean authorities should take relevant steps to prevent such anachronistic anti-DPRK smear campaign at once, mindful that all Koreans and the whole world are closely watching them.

articles.title: US Sparks Cold War and Arms Race--Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
US Sparks Cold War and Arms Race--Rodong Sinmun
Pyongyang, February 10 (KCNA) -- The United States is chief culprit sparking another Cold War and a new arms race, says Rodong Sinmun Thursday in a bylined article.
					 The U.S. warlike forces put spurs to the modernization of military hardware, while massively expanding armaments, defying the desire of mankind for peace, the article says, and goes on:
					
					 U.S. Congress recently adopted a bill on defense authority for fiscal 2011. The defence budget for fiscal 2011 that began from October 1, 2010 totals 725 billion dollars, of which 158.7 billion dollars is allocated for war expenditure. This makes again the U.S. the country with the biggest military expenditure in the world.
					
					 Its military expenditure has shown 15 percent of annual average increase in the new century.
					
					 The establishment of the missile defence system is one on which the U.S. puts main emphasis in the expansion of armaments. 
					
					 It is stepping up MD with preemptive missile attack as an important element of its military strategy in the new century. 
					
					 It has buckled down to the production of new type smaller nuclear weapons. 
					
					 The U.S. nuclear war maniacs attempt to make nuclear weapons which can be used as conventional weapons at warfare.
					
					 The U.S. true nature as arch criminal of the world-wide arms race is also revealed by its persistent nose-thumbing at the efforts of the international community for arms control. 
					
					 The U.S. has topped the world list of munitions sales after the demise of the Cold War. In recent years its munitions export has held half of the world total munitions export. It has become No. 1 arms supplier to dispute-torn and armed clashes-stricken regions.
					
					 It does not hesitate to plunge mankind into the crucible of a war in a bid to realize its ambition to dominate the world.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Work Published in Mexico
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Work Published in Mexico
 Pyongyang, February 10 (KCNA) -- The Publishing House of the Workers' Party of Mexico published in booklet General Secretary Kim Jong Il's work "On the Fundamentals of Revolutionary Party Building" on Feb. 3.
					 The work, published on Oct. 10, Juche 81 (1992), refers to the historical lessons drawn from the building of a ruling party under socialism. It also clarifies the fundamental principles of building the revolutionary party of Juche type and the idea on strengthening internationalist unity and solidarity of the revolutionary parties.

articles.title: North-South Dialogue Called for
articles.content:
North-South Dialogue Called for
 Pyongyang, February 10 (KCNA) -- The General Association of Koreans in China called on all the Koreans in the north and the south and overseas to achieve unity and solidarity with patriotism and work for peace, reunification and prosperity. This call was made in its statement on Feb. 5.
					 The statement expressed support for an appeal to the entire Korean nation made by the Central Committee of the Democratic Front for the Reunification of Korea.
					
					 It said that dialogue and negotiations are the only way of averting a war, defusing confrontation and repairing the north-south relations.
					
					 The negotiating table has already been set for the north and the south to sit face to face and have candid exchange of what they have in mind, it said.
					
					 South Korea should not hesitate to come out for dialogue and negotiations if it is truly concerned for the destiny of the nation and the improvement of the relations, it added. 
					
					 The south Korean authorities should immediately respond to the DPRK's proposal for the north-south dialogue with sincerity, away from unnecessary misgivings and prejudice, it urged.

articles.title: Story of Kim Il Sung
articles.content:
Story of Kim Il Sung
Pyongyang, February 10 (KCNA) -- It happened on one day in the latter half of July, 1935 when the Shandongtun battle was fought during the anti-Japanese armed struggle.
					 Informed of the guerillas' arrival at Shandongtun from East Manchuria, the Japanese imperialists sent there a hundreds-strong cavalry made up of the puppet Manchukuo army and the police.
					
					 President Kim Il Sung mapped out a plan to smash the enemies in coordinated operation with the armed units staying in that area as there were not enough guerilla forces to fight a battle at that time.
					
					 The commanding officers of those units suggested to the President that they rely on firm castle and village in Shandongtun given the short time for the preparation for the battle.
					
					 "That would be of advantage to us but may do harm to the life and property of the people," he said. He proposed advancing units to the ravine west of the village and beating back the enemies there.
					
					 The enemies attempted a wave of attacks but fled the battle in the end, leaving a number of bodies by a volley of fire and mortar shell bombing by the guerillas.
					
					 When the units entered the village after the battle, people were unanimous in saying that the army of the President is the genuine people's army, moved to tears at his popular traits.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il presencia funcion artistica de Unidad 963 del EPC
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il presencia funcion artistica de Unidad 963 del EPC
Pyongyang, 10 de febrero (ATCC) -- El Dirigente Kim Jong Il, Secretario General del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y Comandante Supremo del Ejercito Popular de Corea, presencio junto con los oficiales y soldados del EPC la funcion del grupo de propaganda artistica de la Unidad 963 del EPC que desarrolla dinamicas actividades artisticas en los campos de lucha por producir un gran auge.
					  En la ocasion se presentaron las piezas de distintos generos, entre otras, la poesia de agitacion "Febrero de Corea", el coro mixto "Gloria a nuestro gran partido", la charla comica "Noticias de Huichon" y el coro "Defenderemos de generacion en generacion al General a costa de vida".
					
					  Terminada la funcion, el Dirigente felicito a los ejecutantes por sus exitos logrados en la ocasion respondiendo a las aclamaciones de ellos y espectadores.
					
					  Muy satisfecho de que los miembros del grupo de propaganda artistica hayan ofrecido esta funcion verdadera y combativa con obras excelentes que demuestran la inagotable potencia espiritual de los militares, el Dirigente les agradecio volviendo a apreciar sus exitos.
					
					  Elogio altamente el modo de lucha revolucionario de ellos diciendo que estos artistas del ejercito revolucionario realizan intensamente la propaganda politica y la agitacion economica en los lugares de lucha por el gran auge como el campo de construccion de la Central Hidroelectrica de Huichon, frente avanzado de construccion de la gran potencia prospera, inspirando en los militares la fe en la victoria y el optimismo, la combatividad y el coraje para exterminar a los enemigos.
					
					  Presento las tareas programaticas que serviran de guia para todos los grupos de propaganda artistica en dinamizar sus actividades conforme a la demanda de la epoca del Songun.
					
					  Le acompanaron en la ocasion Kim Jong Un, vicepresidente de la Comision Militar Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Kim Ki Nam y Choe Thae Bok, miembros del Buro Politico y secretarios del Comite Central del PTC, Kim Kyong Hui, miembro del BP y jefa de departamento del CC del PTC, Jang Song Thaek, miembro suplente del BP del CC del PTC y vicepresidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional, Pak To Chun, miembro suplente del BP y secretario del CC del PTC, Mun Kyong Dok, miembro suplente del BP y secretario del CC del PTC y secretario responsable del Comite del PTC en la Ciudad de Pyongyang, Ju Kyu Chang, miembro suplente del BP y jefe de departamento del CC del PTC, Kim Kyong Ok y Yun Jong Rin, miembros de la Comision Militar Central del PTC, Hyon Chol Hae y Ri Myong Su, jefes de departamento del CDN.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il recibe cesto de flores de Mahmoud Abbas
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il recibe cesto de flores de Mahmoud Abbas
Pyongyang, 10 de febrero (ATCC) -- El Dirigente Kim Jong Il recibio un cesto de flores que con motivo de su cumpleanos, le enviara el jefe de la Autoridad Nacional de Palestina, Mahmoud Abbas.
					Lo entrego el dia 10 el embajador palestino en Corea, Ismail Ahmed Mohamed Hasan, a Kim Yong Il, miembro suplente del Buro Politico y secretario del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il recibe cesto de flores de Choummaly Saynasone
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il recibe cesto de flores de Choummaly Saynasone
Pyongyang, 10 de febrero (ATCC) -- El Dirigente Kim Jong Il recibio un cesto de flores que con motivo de su cumpleanos, le enviara Choummaly Saynasone, Secretario General del Comite Central del Partido Popular Revolucionario Lao y Presidente de la Republica Democratica Popular Lao.
					  El encargado laosiano de negocios a.i. en Corea, Somlith Chindavong, lo entrego este jueves a Kim Yong Il, miembro suplente del Buro Politico y secretario del CC del Partido del Trabajo de Corea.

articles.title: Habitantes coreanos indignados por actitud grosera de la parte Sur
articles.content:
Habitantes coreanos indignados por actitud grosera de la parte Sur
Pyongyang, 10 de febrero (ATCC) -- El pueblo coreano se monta en colera por la ruptura del dialogo previo para abrir las conversaciones militares de alto nivel Norte-Sur de Corea efectuado los dias 8 y 9.
					  El viceministro de Industria Quimica Pak Chol (de 52 anos de edad) dijo a la ATCC que esa quiebra es producto del siniestro intento del circulo militar surcoreano de estropear el dialogo.
					
					  Prosiguio que proponer la agenda como "medidas responsables sobre el hundimiento de la corbeta 'Cheonan' por el torpedo y la provocacion de canonazos en la isla Yonphyong" significa un insulto y provocacion para colocar en el banquillo de acusados a la contraparte del dialogo.
					
					   Pienso que los surcoreanos deben debatir los problemas que puedan llegar al consenso, si desean de veras participar en las conservaciones para la distension y el mantenimiento de la paz, concluyo.
					
					El vicepresidente del Comite Central de la Union de Trabajadores Agricolas de Corea, Han Kyong Song, (de 55 anos de edad) subrayo que es injusto insistir unilateralmente en el nivel del jefe de la delegacion sin tomar en cuenta diferentes organizaciones y estructuras militares del Norte y el Sur.
					
					Enfatizo que retrasar la fecha de conversaciones militares de alto nivel es un acto que desafia a la aspiracion de la nacion y la demanda de la epoca de sostener cuanto antes el dialogo amplio y el intercambio.
					
					El director del Instituto de Historia de la Academia de Ciencias Sociales, Jo Hui Sung, (de 59 anos de edad) subrayo que en el dialogo previo quedo revelado que el ejercito surcoreano acudio a desganas a la mesa de dialogo rendido ante la presion interna y externa.
					
					Prosiguio que la verdadera intencion de la parte Sur esta en romper las conversaciones pretextando el llamado "sentimiento del pueblo", creado inventando los complots anti-RPDC de pesima calana, imputar la responsabilidad a esta y justificar los ejercicios militares conjuntos que librara pronto con EE.UU.
					
					Anadio que hoy dia, 70 millones de coreanos y todo el mundo vieron claramente quien es el culpable de enfrentamiento y agravacion de tension en la Peninsula Coreana.

articles.title: ATCC comenta la actitud grosera de la parte Sur en dialogo previo
articles.content:
ATCC comenta la actitud grosera de la parte Sur en dialogo previo
						
  Pyongyang, 10 de febrero (ATCC) -- En el dialogo previo para la apertura de las conversaciones militares de alto nivel Norte-Sur, la parte Sur asumio una actitud grosera ante la paciencia y magnanimidad de la parte Norte.
					  Su arrogancia se ha manifestado en el debate de la composicion de la delegacion. 
					
					  Al principio, la parte Sur no se opuso a nuestra opinion de que "las conversaciones militares de alto nivel pueden tener el rango de ministro o el de general". Ademas, fue ella quien propuso oficialmente definir el nivel del jefe de la delegacion como "general de 4 estrellas".
					
					  Tomando en consideracion la propuesta de la parte Sur, propusimos fijar el nivel del jefe de la delegacion como viceministro de las Fuerzas Armadas Populares y seleccionarlo a conveniencia de cada parte. 
					
					  Entonces, los titeres dijeron que el "viceministro surcoreano de Defensa Nacional no es autoridad militar de alto rango", insistencia absurda que no puede convencer a nadie. 
					
					  Esta insistencia contraviene a la propuesta de si misma y a la voluntad de su superior que a traves de intercambio de mensajes, acordo con el ministro de las Fuerzas Armadas Populares de la parte Norte sostener las conversaciones militares de alto nivel. 
					
					  ?Acaso el viceministro de Defensa Nacional no es la autoridad militar de alto nivel?
					
					Entonces, Quienes son esos "uniformados" que no respetan a sus superiores ni conocen la disciplina de obedecer incondicionalmente a las ordenes?
					
					  Resultan del todo contradictorios sus dichos y acciones.
					
					  Las autoridades surcoreanas, que se autodenominan como "gobierno pragmatico", conceden mayor importancia a las formalidades que los provechos reales. 
					
					  En realidad, ellas consideran las conversaciones militares Norte-Sur como otro escenario de confrontacion con la parte Norte. Pretenden hacer dano a la contraparte con el punto de vista de la epoca vieja, en vez de abrir el camino de avance de la nacion reconciliando y cooperando en la posicion igualitaria. 
					
					  Dado que quedo evidenciado otra vez que las autoridades surcoreanas no tienen la voluntad de dialogar sino se enfrascan solo en la confrontacion fratricida, es natural que nuestra parte considere innecesario tratarse mas con ellas.

articles.title: Tendran lugar varias actividades por el 16 de febrero
articles.content:
Tendran lugar varias actividades por el 16 de febrero
						
Pyongyang, 10 de febrero (ATCC) -- Con motivo del cumpleanos del Dirigente Kim Jong Il se efectuaran variadas actividades en Corea.
					El XV Festival de Kimjongilias se abrira en la capitalina Exhibicion Permanente de Kimilsungia y Kimjongilia con la participacion de los organos de las fuerzas armadas, ministerios, organos centrales y empresas, trabajadores de distintos sectores, jovenes y ninos escolares, entidades de compatriotas en ultramar y extranjeros.
					
					Habran tambien el 20o Festival Internacional de Patinaje Artistico por el Premio Paektusan en que participaran los excelentes deportistas nacionales y extranjeros y la actuacion modelo de la natacion sincronica por el 16 de Febrero.
					
					En el Complejo de Patinaje bajo Techo y en la piscina del Complejo de Piscinas y Servicios de Cultura Fisica Changgwangwon, los talentosos especialistas de deporte y creadores de arte promueven en la etapa final la preparacion de esas actividades deportivas.
					
					Ademas, se efectuaran en esta capital la exhibicion de fotos, la de bellas artes, etc.
					
					Por otra parte, ya quedo inaugurada la Competencia Deportiva por el Premio Paektusan.
